text: so Stephanie a chance to ride on a new
plane recently the Dreamliner what is
that I did it's a 787 it's made by
Boeing and it is more fuel-efficient but
it also has a lot of bells and whistles
that planes currently don't have so
passengers might have the chance to have
a more pleasant flight than in the past
so what are some of those bells and
whistles and how much of a difference
they make in your place some of them
made a real difference for instance the
bathroom if you're germaphobe like I am
and like many people are not clean
exactly you no longer have to flush the
toilet you know you don't have to kind
of put your foot out and try to hit the
button you can actually wave your hand
over sensor and the toilet will flush
and the same thing for the sink which is
great in addition to that you've got
bigger overhead bins everyone's carrying
on their luggage you know so now there's
more room to do that in addition the
plane feels airier the overhead bins
don't come down as low over the window
seat and the middle seat so it feels a
bit better there's lighting that they
have a sort of dynamic LED lighting that
makes the plane brighter and dimmer but
it just feels area yeah you don't it
doesn't feel so oppressive additionally
the windows are bigger they're about 30%
bigger on the 787 than they are on other
commercial airlines about the same size
so that enables you if you're sitting
not next in the window you still feel
like you're getting a little more light
than you might even if you're not the
person right up against that wall any
drawbacks anything you wish they'd
improved better well I wish there was
more room in coach you know you would
always more remember are you or either
that or you wish you were not in coach
but in economy you know basically they
and and Boeing did a version of the
plane that actually had more room but
you know the airlines trying to get more
money obviously added in extra seats so
you've got you know three three and
three going across so it doesn't really
feel like you have more room in your
seat and the same thing with the aisle
so can anyone get on one of these planes
who's flying them right now United is
flying them domestically and yes anybody
can get on the flight you just you know
it's a commercial flight you booked your
ticket when I did it it
is the first North American charter of
the Dreamliner and I was with a group of
people they go to an event called mega
do which is an annual event for hardcore
frequent fliers who want to rack up
miles but also see behind the scenes at
airlines and also hotels how many planes
like this are in circulation and how
many do we think they're gonna be in the
next several you United has two right
now that they're flying but they have on
order at least 50 and they'll probably
get more and you know the way people
should think about this is this is going
to be you know the plane of the future
so the way people know what an Airbus is
now people will know what a 787 is in
the future
